title: Jeremy Corbyn has turned the next general election into a series of impossible demands
text:
Yet there is still some logic to the Labour leader's muddled stance

Monty Python references, though always welcome, seem particularly appropriate to our era of parliamentary slapstick and pantomime.

In Monty Python and the Holy Grail, King Arthur is waylaid in his search for the holy cup by The Knights Who Say “Ni”. They order him to bring them a shrubbery (“A nice one – not too expensive”) as payment for their freedom to pass. Inevitably, when His Majesty completes the task, the knights have another challenge for him, involving the felling of a tree using only a haddock.

And so to Jeremy Corbyn. The Leader of the Opposition has become the first in living memory to turn down the chance of...
description: Yet there is still some logic to the Labour leader's muddled stance
